title: What date will Vikings season 6 be released on Amazon Prime?
text:
The hit show is famous for its brutal, bloody battle scenes (Picture: Rex Features)

Vikings is ready to splash back onto UK screens for season six.

The trailer teased the return of a dead character plus a new enemy for Bjorn, but when will UK fans get to watch it all unfold?

Here’s what you need to know…

When is Vikings returning?

It’s been confirmed that the first episode of the sixth – and final – season of the show will be available for UK viewers from Thursday 5 December.

New episodes will then continue to be made available every Thursday, less than 24 hours after they first air in the United States.

Where can I watch Vikings?

For UK viewers, it’s an Amazon Prime Video exclusive.

The show airs on the History channel in the States.

You’ll need to be a member to view the episodes each week.

Fans will be desperate to watch how it all turns out for Lagertha and co. (Picture: History)

What to expect from Vikings season 6

The new season picks up following season five’s battle between brothers which saw Bjorn victorious and winning the admiration of the people who had been under the tyrannical rule of Ivar.

Meanwhile, Ivar, searching for a new path, is seen traveling along The Silk Road leading him to Russia. He meets Prince Oleg, a ruthless and unpredictable Russian ruler, who shocks even the vicious Ivar with his merciless actions.

It’s about to hit the fan in season 6 of Vikings – says Peter Franzen

(Pictures: Getty/Peter Franzen/Instagram)

Fans should prepare for anything. Star Peter Franzen recently insisted the proverbial will hit the fan in the final season.

Echoing this, show creator Michael Hirst, said: ‘[season six] will deliver a huge and unexpected revelation to our audience.’

While the show is famous for violence and bloodshed, the actors are more prone to soppy social media posts.
